org.dlw.ai.blackboard.domain
Class Affirmation

java.lang.Object
  org.dlw.ai.blackboard.domain.Affirmation

public class Affirmation
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a literal stack of assumptions about a particular blackboard object. Some assumptions are more opportunistic, such as assertions.

The public method cipherText() will return the cipherText letter at any time and can be used to set the "affirmed" character if assumed to have a plain-text solution back to the cipher character if needed. The plainText() method, however will only return the plain-text character if an Alphabet object has been created and placed on the Blackboard.

The Affirmation is a collection of statements Assumption and/or Assertion about a particular domain object. A number of assumptions could define an Assertion but the Affirmation is the public offering that this CipherLetter is ready to be considered.

Affirmation - "(def.) statement of facts; asserted strongly and publicly (at the blackboard perchance?)

Version:
1.0.0-RC
Author:
David L. Whitehurst
